chargeHist.descr: Intentionally Point Firearm at Law Enforcement Officer, Fire Fighter, Emerg Medical Tech, etc.
Intentionally Point Firearm at Law Enforcement Officer, Fire Fighter, Emerg Medical Tech, etc.

result.execSummary:
The defendant Allen Jeffrey Dekeyser was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate Firearm w/Controlled Substance, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(bm).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Allen Jeffrey Dekeyser

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Allen Jeffrey Dekeyser in court.  Attorney Patrick Michael Brady in court for Allen Jeffrey Dekeyser.  Attorney Megan Marie Newport in court for State of Wisconsin. Amended Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. 

Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 2 and 3.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Parties prepared to proceed with sentencing. Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.

AS TO COUNT 2: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 3. Court STAYED the sentence(s) and placed the defendant on probation for 15 MONTHS.

AS TO COUNT 3: Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to count 2. Court STAYED the sentence(s) and placed the defendant on probation for 15 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Mental health assessment and comply with any treatment.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Maintain full time employment.
- Complete an anger management class
- No contact with firearms.
- Provide a DNA sample. 

- Defendant to pay all applicable costs, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharges during the period of probation. Failure to pay the costs and surcharges will result in a civil judgment.


Filed: 
Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights

Defendant Allen Jeffrey Dekeyser not in court.  Attorney Patrick Michael Brady appeared by video for Allen Jeffrey Dekeyser.  Prosecuting attorney Megan Marie Newport appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. At the request of the State, case called on the record today. State advises the Court that this case is in resolution posture and requests more time. Defense in agreement. Court finds good cause to vacate 10/3/2022 jury trial date. Case adjourned. Case remains calendared in Br 4.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Allen Jeffrey Dekeyser in court with attorney Patrick Michael Brady.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Final Pretrial held. State advises of amended information. Defense request to arraign on jury trial date. Court grants. Case remains in trial posture. Case remains calendared for Jury Trial, Branch 4.
Defendant's Witness List, received and filed
Defendant's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
State's Motion in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.

Defendant Allen Jeffrey Dekeyser in court with attorney Patrick Michael Brady.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Allen Jeffrey Dekeyser appeared by video means with Attorney.   Case in court for scheduling conference.  defense counsel requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by the final pretrial date. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Final Pre-Trial scheduled for 8/19/22 at 8:30 am Jury Trial scheduled 10/3/22 at 8:30 am

Defendant Allen Jeffrey Dekeyser in court with attorney Patrick Michael Brady.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Case in court for status conference. Defense requests more time. State does not object. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.  Status conference scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Patrick Michael Brady in court, defendant Allen Jeffrey Dekeyser not in court, in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for scheduling conference. Defense requests more time for review. State does not object. Defense requests that bail be return to the posting party. Court orders that anything overage of the bail of $2,500.00 be returned to the posting trial. Court orders that any suppression motions due on 6-10-2022. Case remains calendared in Branch 4.

Defendant Allen Jeffrey Dekeyser in court with Attorney Patrick Michael Brady.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective M. Gretenhardt. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 04.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Remaining cash bail posted to be returned to the remitter.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Allen Jeffrey Dekeyser in court with attorney Patrick Michael Brady.  Erin Michelle Karshen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Hanrahan, Branch 4.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.
